result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrell C Little

Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. No contact with the victim T.L (person, property, residence or family).

2:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrell C Little appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Derrell C Little. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
